title: Salem woman who ran ‘creepy creations’ shop to plead guilty in Harvard morgue scandal
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Katrina Maclean to plead guilty for selling stolen human remains from Harvard morgue via her Peabody shop.
Maclean purchased remains from former Harvard morgue manager Cedric Lodge and faces up to 10 years imprisonment.
Harvard launched an independent review after scandal led to dozens withdrawing body donations and legal repercussions.

title: Tell us: What’s the best New England town for a winter weekend getaway?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Boston.com is seeking recommendations for the best New England towns for winter weekend getaways from travelers.
New England destinations like Nantucket, Sandwich, and Woodstock are highlighted as scenic winter towns by Country Living.
Readers can share their favorite winter getaway spots via email or an online form for potential feature on Boston.com.

title: Boston ranks among best U.S. cities for Thanksgiving — and tops New England
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Boston ranked 18th on WalletHub's list of top 100 U.S. Thanksgiving destinations.
Boston was the only New England city featured, thanks to its vibrant restaurant scene.
Boston excelled in dining quality and volunteer opportunities, contributing to its high ranking.

title: Five years after debuting ‘Java with Jimmy,’ host James Hills isn’t slowing down
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: James 'Jimmy' Hills started 'Java with Jimmy' as a Facebook livestream in response to COVID-19 five years ago.
Hills, an adviser to Mayor Michelle Wu, has become an influential community voice, interviewing politicians and local figures.
Hills aims to expand 'Java with Jimmy' into a larger platform and potentially a community center, but rules out running for office.

title: Roman Anthony earns a third place finish for AL Rookie of the Year
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Roman Anthony finished third in the AL Rookie of the Year voting, behind Nick Kurtz and Jacob Wilson.
Anthony hit .292 with eight home runs in 71 games despite an oblique injury limiting his season.
Anthony's third-place finish affected bonuses but he secured an eight-year, $130 million extension with the Red Sox.

title: Federal judge orders release of Fitchburg woman detained by ICE in viral video
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Federal judge orders the immediate release of Juliana Milena Ojeda Montoya from ICE detention in Cumberland County Jail.
Ojeda Montoya, 24, was detained during a traffic stop in Fitchburg; the arrest video went viral.
Judge Stacey D. Neumann found her detention violated due process rights and noted the Laken Riley Act's inapplicability.

title: How Mass. lawmakers are reacting to the deal that could end the government shutdown
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts lawmakers criticize the Senate's funding package, citing concerns over expiring health care subsidies affecting 330,000 residents.
House members, including Rep. Seth Moulton and Rep. Ayanna Pressley, oppose the deal for failing to address rising health care costs.
Senators Elizabeth Warren and Ed Markey argue the deal makes a mistake by not extending Affordable Care Act subsidies.

title: Boston firefighters battle 2-alarm blaze at multi-family home in Dorchester
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Fire Department battled a two-alarm fire on Train Street in Dorchester Tuesday, displacing two residents.
Firefighters extinguished the heavy flames by 9:30 a.m.; damages are estimated at $500,000.
One firefighter was hospitalized, and the cause of the fire is under investigation by the Boston Fire Investigation Unit.

title: Here’s what Jon Stewart had to say about the Senate Democrats voting to end the shutdown
author: John Waller
bullets: Jon Stewart criticized Senate Democrats for their actions in ending the government shutdown.
Stewart described the Democrats' vote as a 'world class collapse' during his commentary.
The Senate voted on legislation aimed at ending the ongoing federal government shutdown.

title: Patrice Bergeron was asked about possible 2026 Hall of Fame induction
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patrice Bergeron expressed humility about a potential 2026 Hall of Fame induction despite strong career achievements.
Bergeron retired in 2023 after 19 seasons with the Bruins, winning the Selke Trophy six times.
Zdeno Chara praised Bergeron as a great leader during his Hall of Fame induction speech.
